contextId.occurrenceNote: These words are a proverb that Jeremiah heard people say when they were complaining that Yahweh was punishing children for the sins of their fathers. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/writing-proverbs]])
contextId.glQuote: Fathers have eaten sour grapes, but the children's teeth are dulled

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jeremiah restates the proverb so that it now means people will suffer as a consequence of their own behaviors. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/writing-proverbs]])
contextId.glQuote: everyone who eats sour grapes, his teeth will be dulled
